ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ValueRange: MRI; PET; CT; SPECT; ultrasound; FA; X-Ray; spectroscopy; microscopy; DEXA; fNIRS; External Camera Photography
Notes: Computed Radiography; Computed Tomography; External Camera Photography; FA; General Microscopy; MRI; Magnetic Resonance; Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy; Nuclear Medicine; Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography; Ultrasound

ValueRange: Axial; Coronal; Sagittal; Surface Image; AC-PC Line
Notes: !=DICOM means not equal DICOM; Anterior commissure-Posterior commissure line

ValueRange: Inches; Centimeters; Angstroms; Nanometers; Micrometers; Millimeters; Meters; Kilometers; Miles; Nanoseconds; Microseconds; Milliseconds; Seconds; Minutes; Hours; Hertz; Diffusion gradient; frame number; number of Volumes (across time)

ElementDescription: Image history,f.e. transformations steps and other modifications.
Image description, i.e. DTI, fMRI, Fast SPGR, phantom, EEG, dynamic PET
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
